New Records: Chahal's 67 T20I wickets are now the most for India, overtaking Bumrah's 66 scalps.
Key Match Events: India won the match by 7 wickets (with 17 balls remaining)
Bhuvneshwar Kumar rocked Sri Lanka with two early blows
Pre-Game Insights: India have won ten T20Is on the trot since losing to New Zealand at the T20 World Cup.
Sri Lanka have won three and lost 12 of the 16 T20Is they have played in India.
Ishan Kishan on India's approach with the bat at the start of the innings
Post-Match Reflections: India's goal is to be the best fielding side at the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia, as Rohit Sharma said after the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain could play spoilsport on Saturday as well in Dharamsala.
Given the last T20I in Dharamsala was played back in 2016, it's difficult to say how the pitch will behave.
